txt1: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  Once confirming the basic information occurs, assessing the performance of the process needs to be done.  After assessing the performance of the process, one or more of the following paths should be executed: noting which steps can be automated, assessing if any steps are confusing.  Then, writing the potential process improvements should be done.  When writing the potential process improvements is completed, you need to get approval for processing improvements. When getting approval for processing improvements is completed, the next tasks should be using the updated process and determining what improvements should go forward, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: scheduling the next process review and optimization, determining how the process will be monitored.  The process is now completed.

txt1: The text below is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  When confirming the basic information is completed, assessing the performance of the process should be done.  Once assessing the performance of the process occurs, looking to see if the process can be simplified needs to be done.  Once looking to see if the process can be simplified occurs, writing the potential process improvements should be done.  When writing the potential process improvements is completed, you need to get approval for processing improvements. After getting approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following paths should be executed: adding feedback on the updated process, using the updated process.  Once adding feedback on the updated process occurs, the next tasks should be determining what improvements should go forward and defining what would make the improvements successful, they should be done in parallel.  Once determining what improvements should go forward occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: choosing who will test the updated process, updating the process documents.  Then, one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining how the process will be monitored, scheduling the next process review and optimization.  The process is now completed.

Once feedback on the updated process is provided, the next tasks should be determining which improvements should proceed and defining what would make the improvements successful, in parallel. Once determining what improvements should be implemented, one or more of the following paths should be executed: choosing who will test the updated process, updating the process documents. Then one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining how the process will be monitored, scheduling the next process review and optimization The process is now finished.

txt1: The text below is about the process for optimizing a process. It starts with confirming the basic information.  Once confirming the basic information occurs, confirming if the process requires optimization needs to be done.  Once confirming if the process requires optimization occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: considering where bottlenecks occur, assessing if any steps are confusing. After writing the potential process improvements, getting approval for processing improvements should be done.  Once getting approval for processing improvements occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining what improvements should go forward, adding feedback on the updated process, choosing who will test the updated process.  Once determining what improvements should go forward occurs, updating the process documents needs to be done.  Then, one or more of the following paths should be executed: communicating the process changes, scheduling the next process review and optimization.  The process is now completed.

Then, the next tasks should be examining potentially wasteful steps and assessing if any steps are confusing, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then writing the potential process improvements should be done.  When writing the potential process improvements is completed, getting approval for processing improvements should be done.  After getting approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following paths should be executed: adding feedback on the updated process, using the updated process.  When adding feedback on the updated process is completed, defining what would make the improvements successful needs to be done.  Then, scheduling the next process review and optimization needs to be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following text is about the process for optimising a process. It starts with the basic information confirming. After confirming the basic information, one or more of the following paths should be executed : identifying the component of the process, assessing the performance of the process. The next task should then be to examine potentially wasted steps and to determine if any steps are confusing. They should be done parallel to this. After all pre-tasks are executed, then writing should be done to the possible process improvements. When the writing of the potential process improvements is completed, approval for processing improvements should be done. After getting approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following steps should be executed : adding feedback on the updated process, using the updated process. When the feedback on the updated process is complete, it must be determined what makes the improvements successful. Then needs to be the next process review and optimization done. The process is completed now.

txt1: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process. It starts with confirming the basic information.  After confirming the basic information, confirming if the process requires optimization should be done.  After confirming if the process requires optimization, the next tasks should be defining how long it takes to complete the process and considering where bottlenecks occur, they should be done in parallel.  When defining how long it takes to complete the process is completed, you need to note which steps can be automated. Once all pre-tasks are executed, then writing the potential process improvements should be done.  After writing the potential process improvements, you need to get approval for processing improvements. Once getting approval for processing improvements occurs, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: adding feedback on the updated process and choosing who will test the updated process.  Once adding feedback on the updated process occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining what improvements should go forward, updating the process documents, using the updated process.  When choosing who will test the updated process is completed, defining what would make the improvements successful needs to be done.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining how the process will be monitored, implementing the process changes.  After determining how the process will be monitored, one or more of the following paths should be executed: communicating the process changes, scheduling the next process review and optimization.  The process is now completed.

After verifying the basic information, confirmation should be performed if the process requires optimization. After confirming whether the process requires optimization, the next tasks should be defining how long it takes to complete the process and considering where bottlenecks occur, and should be done in parallel. When defining how long it takes to complete the process, you need to note which steps can be automated. Once all pre-tasks are performed, then writing the potential improvements of the process should be done. After writing the possible improvement in the process, you need to get approval for processing improvements. Once approval for processing improvements is received, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: adding feedback on the updated process and choosing who will test the updated process. Once the feedback on the updated process appears, one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining what improvements should be brought forward, updating the process documentation and using the updated process. When selecting who will test the updated process is finished, it must be determined what would make the improvements successful. Once all pre-tasks are executed, one or more of the following paths should be executed : determining how the process will be monitored ; implementing the process changes. After determining how the process will be monitored, one or more of the following paths should be executed: communicating the process changes, arranging the next process review and optimizing. The process is now complete.

txt1: The text below is about the process for optimizing a process. It starts with confirming the basic information.  Once confirming the basic information occurs, the next tasks should be confirming if the process requires optimization and assessing the performance of the process, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: examining potentially wasteful steps, noting which steps can be automated.  Once examining potentially wasteful steps occurs, defining how long it takes to complete the process should be done.  After noting which steps can be automated, you need to assess if any steps are confusing. Afterwards, you need to write the potential process improvements. After writing the potential process improvements, getting approval for processing improvements should be done.  Once getting approval for processing improvements occurs, the process is split into 3 parallel branches: updating the process documents, choosing who will test the updated process and using the updated process.  When using the updated process is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: defining what would make the improvements successful, adding feedback on the updated process.  After defining what would make the improvements successful, determining what improvements should go forward needs to be done.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: implementing the process changes, communicating the process changes, scheduling the next process review and optimization.  After communicating the process changes, determining how the process will be monitored should be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The text below is about the process of optimising a process, which starts with confirmation of basic information. Once examining potentially wasted steps occurs, it is important to determine how long it takes to complete the process. After noting which steps can be automated, you must assess if any steps are confusing. After you write the potential process improvements. After writing the potential process improvements, approval for the improvements should be done. When approval is obtained for processing improvements, the process is divided into 3 parallel branches: updating the process documents, choosing who will test the updated process and using the updated process. When the use of the updated process is completed, one or more of the following steps should be followed: defining what would make improvements successful, adding feedback on the updated process.  After defining what would make the improvements successful, it is advisable to know what improvements should be made to continue. Once all pre-tasks are executed, one or more of the following should be executed: implementing the process changes, communicating the process changes, scheduling the next process review and optimization. After bringing out the changes in the process, it should be determined how the process will be monitored. The process is now completed.

Once getting approval for processing improvements occurs, the next tasks should be defining what would make the improvements successful, adding feedback on the updated process and determining what improvements should go forward, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then you need to communicate the process changes. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following description is about the process for optimizing a process. It starts with confirming the basic information.  After confirming the basic information, confirming if the process requires optimization needs to be done.  Once confirming if the process requires optimization occurs, the process is split into 3 parallel branches: examining potentially wasteful steps, considering where bottlenecks occur and defining how long it takes to complete the process.  After examining potentially wasteful steps, one or more of the following paths should be executed: noting which steps can be automated, looking to see if the process can be simplified.  After considering where bottlenecks occur, you need to assess if any steps are confusing. Once all pre-tasks are executed, then writing the potential process improvements needs to be done.  After writing the potential process improvements, getting approval for processing improvements needs to be done.  When getting approval for processing improvements is completed, choosing who will test the updated process needs to be done.  When choosing who will test the updated process is completed, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: determining how the process will be monitored and communicating the process changes.  After determining how the process will be monitored, you need to implement the process changes. The process is now completed.
txt2: The following description is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins with confirming the basic information. After confirming the basic information, confirms if the process requires optimization Once confirmed if the process requires optimization, the process is divided into 3 parallel branches : investigating potentially wasteful steps, considering where bottlenecks occur and defining how long it takes to complete the process. After looking at potentially wasteful steps, one or more of the following paths should be executed: noting which steps can be automated, and looking to see if the process can be simplified. After considering where bottlenecks occur, you need to determine if steps are confusing or not. Once all Pre-Tasks are executed, the potential process improvement needs to be written. After writing the potential process improvements, it is necessary to get approval for the processing improvements. When approval for processing improvements is completed, choosing who will test the updated process needs to be done. When choosing who will test the updated process is completed, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: determining how the process will be monitored and communicating process changes. After determining how the process will be monitored, it is necessary to implement the changes in the process. The process is now complete.

Once confirming the basic information occurs, you need to identify the process's components. After identifying the process's components, one or more of the following paths should be executed: examining potentially wasteful steps, noting which steps can be automated.  Once noting which steps can be automated occurs, you need to look to see if the process can be simplified. Afterwards, writing the potential process improvements needs to be done.  Once writing the potential process improvements occurs, you need to get approval for processing improvements. When getting approval for processing improvements is completed, the next tasks should be using the updated process and defining what would make the improvements successful, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then the process is split into 3 parallel branches: implementing the process changes, scheduling the next process review and optimization and determining how the process will be monitored.  When scheduling the next process review and optimization is completed, communicating the process changes needs to be done.  The process is now completed.

txt1: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  When confirming the basic information is completed, assessing the performance of the process needs to be done.  After assessing the performance of the process, considering where bottlenecks occur needs to be done.  After considering where bottlenecks occur, writing the potential process improvements should be done.  When writing the potential process improvements is completed, getting approval for processing improvements should be done.  When getting approval for processing improvements is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining what improvements should go forward, updating the process documents.  When determining what improvements should go forward is completed, the next tasks should be choosing who will test the updated process and defining what would make the improvements successful, they should be done in parallel.  Then, one or more of the following paths should be executed: scheduling the next process review and optimization, implementing the process changes, determining how the process will be monitored.  When determining how the process will be monitored is completed, communicating the process changes should be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process and starts when you confirm the basic information. When confirming the basic information is completed, the performance of the process should be matched. Upon assessing the performance of the process, consideration must be made where bottlenecks occur. After considering where bottlenecks exist, it should be written about the potential improvement of the process. If the writing of the potential process improvements is completed, approval for processing improvements should be done. When approval for the processing improvements is complete, one or more of the following should be executed: identifying which improvements should continue, updating the process documents. When determining what improvement should go forward is complete, the next tasks should be choosing who will test the updated process and defining what would make the improvements successful. The steps should be done parallel to each other. Then, one or more of the following paths should be executed: scheduling the next process review and optimization, implementing the process changes, determining how the process will be monitored. When determined how the process will be monitored, communication should be done regarding the change in process. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process. It starts with confirming the basic information.  After confirming the basic information, the next tasks should be confirming if the process requires optimization and assessing the performance of the process, they should be done in parallel. Once getting approval for processing improvements occurs, the process is split into 3 parallel branches: adding feedback on the updated process, updating the process documents and choosing who will test the updated process.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then the process is split into 2 parallel branches: scheduling the next process review and optimization and determining how the process will be monitored.  Once scheduling the next process review and optimization occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: communicating the process changes, implementing the process changes.  The process is now completed.

txt1: The text below is about the process for optimizing a process. It starts with confirming the basic information.  After confirming the basic information, one or more of the following paths should be executed: confirming if the process requires optimization, identifying the process's components.  When identifying the process's components is completed, assessing the performance of the process needs to be done.  Then, the next tasks should be considering where bottlenecks occur, noting which steps can be automated and assessing if any steps are confusing, they should be done in parallel.  After noting which steps can be automated, the next tasks should be examining potentially wasteful steps and looking to see if the process can be simplified, they should be done in parallel.  Once examining potentially wasteful steps occurs, defining how long it takes to complete the process needs to be done.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then you need to write the potential process improvements. After writing the potential process improvements, getting approval for processing improvements should be done.  After getting approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following paths should be executed: choosing who will test the updated process, using the updated process.  When using the updated process is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: adding feedback on the updated process, defining what would make the improvements successful.  Once defining what would make the improvements successful occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: updating the process documents, determining what improvements should go forward.  Then, one or more of the following paths should be executed: implementing the process changes, determining how the process will be monitored.  After implementing the process changes, communicating the process changes needs to be done.  The process is now completed.

txt1: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  After confirming the basic information, the next tasks should be assessing the performance of the process and confirming if the process requires optimization, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: examining potentially wasteful steps, assessing if any steps are confusing, noting which steps can be automated.  Then, writing the potential process improvements needs to be done.  After writing the potential process improvements, getting approval for processing improvements needs to be done.  After getting approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following paths should be executed: choosing who will test the updated process, adding feedback on the updated process.  Once adding feedback on the updated process occurs, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: determining what improvements should go forward and updating the process documents.  Then, you need to schedule the next process review and optimization. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process. It starts with confirming the basic information.  After confirming the basic information, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: assessing the performance of the process and identifying the process's components.  When identifying the process's components is completed, you need to confirm if the process requires optimization. Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: considering where bottlenecks occur, assessing if any steps are confusing.  After considering where bottlenecks occur, the next tasks should be looking to see if the process can be simplified and noting which steps can be automated, they should be done in parallel.  When noting which steps can be automated is completed, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: examining potentially wasteful steps and defining how long it takes to complete the process.  After that, writing the potential process improvements needs to be done.  When writing the potential process improvements is completed, you need to get approval for processing improvements. After getting approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following paths should be executed: defining what would make the improvements successful, updating the process documents, using the updated process.  After that, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: determining how the process will be monitored and scheduling the next process review and optimization.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process. After having verified the basic information, the process is split into two parallel branches: assessing the performance of the process and identifying the process components. When identifying the process components is completed, you need to confirm if the process requires optimization. Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following path should be executed: evaluating where bottlenecks occur, assessing if any steps are confusing. After considering where bottlenecks occur the next task should look at if the process can be simplified and remembering which steps can be automated, they should be done in parallel. When noting which steps can be automated is completed the process is divided into 2 parallel branches: examining potentially wasteful steps and defining how long it takes to complete the process. Ensuite, the potential improvement of the process needs to be written. When the write is completed on potential process improvements, you need approval for processing improvements. After receiving the approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following paths should be executed : defining what would make the improvements successful, updating process documents, using the updated process. After that, the process is broken into 2 parallel branches : determining how the process will be monitored and scheduling the next process review and optimization. The process is now complete.

txt1: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  After confirming the basic information, the next tasks should be confirming if the process requires optimization and assessing the performance of the process, they should be done in parallel. When noting which steps can be automated is completed, looking to see if the process can be simplified needs to be done.  Afterwards, writing the potential process improvements should be done.  After writing the potential process improvements, getting approval for processing improvements needs to be done.  Once getting approval for processing improvements occurs, updating the process documents should be done.  After updating the process documents, the next tasks should be communicating the process changes and implementing the process changes, they should be done in parallel.  After communicating the process changes, one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining how the process will be monitored, scheduling the next process review and optimization.  The process is now completed.

txt1: The text below is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  After confirming the basic information, confirming if the process requires optimization needs to be done.  After confirming if the process requires optimization, considering where bottlenecks occur should be done.  When considering where bottlenecks occur is completed, writing the potential process improvements should be done.  After writing the potential process improvements, getting approval for processing improvements should be done.  After getting approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following paths should be executed: choosing who will test the updated process, adding feedback on the updated process.  Once choosing who will test the updated process occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: using the updated process, defining what would make the improvements successful, determining what improvements should go forward.  After using the updated process, updating the process documents needs to be done.  After that, the next tasks should be implementing the process changes and communicating the process changes, they should be done in parallel.  When implementing the process changes is completed, scheduling the next process review and optimization needs to be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The below text is about the process for optimizing a process, which begins when you confirm basic information. After confirming basic information, confirm if the process needs to be optimized. After confirming if the process requires optimization, determining where bottlenecks occur should be done. When considering where bottlenecks occur should be done writing the potential process improvements. Following writing the potential process improvements, it should be done for approval for processing improvements. After receiving approval for processing improvements one or more of the following paths should be executed : choosing who will test the updated process, submitting feedback on the updated process. Once choosing who will test the updated process occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: using the updated process, defining what would make the improvements successful, determining which improvements should proceed. After using the updated process, the documents must be updated. After that the next tasks should be implementing and recommending process changes, they should be done in parallel. When the process change implementation is completed, the next review and optimization of the process needs to be done. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following text is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  Once confirming the basic information occurs, identifying the process's components needs to be done.  Once identifying the process's components occurs, you need to consider where bottlenecks occur. When considering where bottlenecks occur is completed, you need to write the potential process improvements. Once writing the potential process improvements occurs, getting approval for processing improvements should be done.  After getting approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following paths should be executed: adding feedback on the updated process, updating the process documents.  Once adding feedback on the updated process occurs, the next tasks should be choosing who will test the updated process and defining what would make the improvements successful, they should be done in parallel.  Once choosing who will test the updated process occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining what improvements should go forward, using the updated process.  Afterwards, the next tasks should be determining how the process will be monitored and communicating the process changes, they should be done in parallel.  After determining how the process will be monitored, you need to implement the process changes. The process is now completed.

After getting approval for processing improvements, one or more of the following paths should be executed: adding feedback on the updated process, updating process documents. Once feedback on the updated process is added, the next task should be choosing who will test the updated process and defining what will make improvements successful. They should be done in parallel. Once the choice who will test the updated process occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining which improvements should proceed using the updated process. Next tasks should determine how the process will be monitored and should be provided as new changes to the process. They should be done in parallel. After determining how the process will be monitored, you have to implement the process changes. The procedure is now complete.

txt1: The following description is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  After confirming the basic information, one or more of the following paths should be executed: assessing the performance of the process, identifying the process's components.  Once assessing the performance of the process occurs, confirming if the process requires optimization should be done.  Then, one or more of the following paths should be executed: defining how long it takes to complete the process, noting which steps can be automated, examining potentially wasteful steps. After getting approval for processing improvements, determining what improvements should go forward needs to be done.  After determining what improvements should go forward, one or more of the following paths should be executed: communicating the process changes, implementing the process changes, determining how the process will be monitored. txt1: The following description is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  When confirming the basic information is completed, you need to assess the performance of the process. Once assessing the performance of the process occurs, you need to look to see if the process can be simplified. When looking to see if the process can be simplified is completed, you need to write the potential process improvements. After writing the potential process improvements, getting approval for processing improvements needs to be done.  After getting approval for processing improvements, the next tasks should be defining what would make the improvements successful, adding feedback on the updated process and updating the process documents, they should be done in parallel.  Once adding feedback on the updated process occurs, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: using the updated process and choosing who will test the updated process.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: scheduling the next process review and optimization, determining how the process will be monitored.  Once scheduling the next process review and optimization occurs, communicating the process changes needs to be done.  The process is now completed.

txt1: The text below is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information.  When confirming the basic information is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: confirming if the process requires optimization, identifying the process's components.  Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: examining potentially wasteful steps, looking to see if the process can be simplified, noting which steps can be automated.  After looking to see if the process can be simplified, considering where bottlenecks occur needs to be done.  Once noting which steps can be automated occurs, the next tasks should be assessing if any steps are confusing and defining how long it takes to complete the process, they should be done in parallel.  After that, you need to write the potential process improvements. After writing the potential process improvements, getting approval for processing improvements needs to be done.  Once getting approval for processing improvements occurs, choosing who will test the updated process needs to be done.  After choosing who will test the updated process, implementing the process changes needs to be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The text below is about the process for optimizing a process. It begins when you confirm the basic information. When the basic information is validated, one or more of the following paths should be executed : confirming if the process requires optimization, identifying the process components. Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: examining potentially wasted steps to see if the process can be simplified and to note which steps can be automated. After looking to see if the process can be simplified, consideration of where bottlenecks occur needs to be done. Once it is noted which steps can be automated, the next tasks should be assessing if any steps are confusing, and defining how long it takes to complete the process. Then these should be done in parallel. After that, you should write the potential process improvements. After writing down the potential improvement of processes, approval for processing improvements needs to be done. Once approval for processing improvements occurs, the choosing of who will test the updated process should be made. After choosing who will test the updated process, the process changes must be implemented. The process is now complete.
